Key: Huh...?
Is this... a shrine...?
(What am I doing here?)

(If I'm at a shrine, does that mean I came here to
pray?)
Prayer...

(Oh, that's right, I remember now! I'm here to
pray for success on my entrance exam.)

(I am currently... a student who failed his first
college entrance exam.)
(I came here to pray for a successful exam.)

(I have to get in college this year. So I have to
pray with all I've got.)
(All right, let's do this.)
(...Wait a minute.)
(Seems like someone's inside.)
(Is that... a shrine maiden?)
(She sure is pretty...)

(I didn't know the shrine had such a beautiful
shrine maiden...)
(What do I do? Should I say hi to her?)

(No. I mean, I'm not going to talk to her just
because she's pretty.)

(I'm going to pray here, so it's only polite to
pay my respects to the person working here.)
U-Um...
Hello.
H-Hello. Um, is it okay if I pray here?

Of course. This shrine is good for safety, success
in business, safe births, exorcisms, cursing your
enemies to death, and various other things.
Wait... The last one sounded questionable.

Of course, it's also very good for passing
entrance exams.
Oh, yes.

(How weird. Something about her tone made it seem
pretty barbaric. Oh well.)

Anyways, well, I've come to pray for
a successful exam.
I thought so.
Huh? How did you know?
I could tell just by looking upon your face.
I-I see.

(Wow, this shrine maiden is amazing. Maybe she has
some sort of sixth sense.)

Besides, we have many visitors here praying for a
successful entrance exam.
Oh, I see. Then this shrine must really work.

Not only that, but I was waiting for you to come,
Shido Itsuka.
Wait, what...? How do you know my name?!

Huh...? Oh yes, I haven't introduced myself yet.
I am Origami Tobiichi. The shrine maiden of this
place.

That's great. But how did you know my name...? Do
you have some kind of supernatural vision...?

No, I just saw your name on the wooden plaque when
you came to pray last year.
Are you serious?! Did I even do that?
But still, you remembered my name just from that?

Since I saw you back then, I've had my eyes
on you.
Eyes on me... Wait, what? What do you mean?
Of course I mean in a sexual way.
That sure is direct!

(It's flattering to have such a beautiful person
say that about me, but she said it with such a
straight face, it was shocking...)

I prayed that you would come again this year so I
could see you.

What the—! So maybe that had something to do with
my failing...
Maybe, maybe not.
Which is it?

No need to rush. I will be introducing a special
prayer to you this year.
A special prayer?
Yes. The Special Shido Itsuka Prayer.

That's obviously suspicious! Why is my name on the
prayer?

This one works very well. My wish came true,
at least. See? I got to see you.
No, thank you!

All I want is to pass my entrance exam. Shouldn't
I just put money into the donation box and
pray...?

Unfortunately, I would say it is impossible for
you to pass unless you do the special prayer.
It's that bad?!

I have already prayed that I can see you
again next year.
Excuse me?!
(What is wrong with this shrine maiden...)

If you want to pass, then you're going to have to
pray with the special prayer and overwrite my
wish.
Can I really pass?

If you follow my instructions, I can guarantee
that you'll pass. Those who have done the
special prayer thus far have passed 100%.

100%?! That sounds even more suspicious... Are you
sure?
I swear to God.
That's amazing... Then I'll do it.

So you agree? You wish to do the successful
entrance exam prayer?
Y-Yes... Wait a minute...
What...?
I'm curious about what that entails.

Don't worry. Just do as I say, and all will
be well.

What if I have to sign some kind of shady contract
and later realize I've agreed to buy something
weird?

Don't worry, that won't happen. The special prayer
is completely free. Anyone can do it. The only
difference is in the way one prays.
I-If that's the case...
You want to do it?

(I've never heard of having to do a special
prayer. Hm... Honestly I'm worried.)

(But I guess I have no choice but to do it. I have
to pass this year. If I take too long, I may end
up in the same grade as Kotori.)
What do you want to do?
Pray.
Don't do it.
...Argh, fine! I'll do it! Please!
The special prayer?
The special prayer!

(It must be one powerful prayer. That's why I need
it. I'm certain of it.)
Then let's start.
Okay.

First, you're going to put up your pointer finger,
and put your hand on your head.
L-Like this...?
Pretty good. Now open up your legs.
Legs? ...Like this?

No, you want to be more bow-legged. And you should
unzip your fly.
Bow-legged... M-My fly, too?!

"Yes. Then roll back your eyes and stick out your
tongue. Then say, "OPPOSUM! OPPOSSUM!" And run
around the shrine as fast as you can three times."

What... Are you serious?! Do I really have
to do that?
I'm kidding, of course.
You're kidding?!
Take this serious! I mean it!

The path to God must have humor. That's what
Sugawara no Michizane said.
That's such a lie!
(Seriously, what is up with this shrine maiden...)
Anyways, jokes aside...
Seriously... I need you to do good.

If you're going to pray for a successful exam,
first you'll need to close your eyes.

Close my eyes... A-Are you sure about this?
It better not be a joke this time.

If you embody the earthly feeling of fear, your
wish will not come true. Have courage.

(The shrine maiden's words are the most
suspicious, though.)

(Her expression doesn’t change, so it's hard to
tell if it's all a joke or not.)
Well... I'll close my eyes, then.
They're closed.
Then stay put.
(Huh...? I sense... someone moving.)
(Is she... coming near me?)
And stay still.
(So she is coming closer?!)
(Whoa! Close! She's close!)

(Her breath... It seems like it's grazing
my cheeks?!)

(Something... very soft seemed to be pushing
against my cheeks... What is it? Could it be...)
All done. You can open your eyes now.
Um... Okay.

(When I opened my eyes, nothing seemed
different...)
Um, what did you do?

Just a little prayer. Besides that, it's a secret.
If you find out, its effects will go away.
I see...
(What did she do to me...?)
So this concludes my prayer?
Yup. It's over. However...

If you wish, we can go to a secluded place at the
back of the shrine, and do a super special prayer
until the morning.

*Grunt*... That seems dangerous for some reason,
so I will refrain.
I see. How unfortunate. I won't force it.
Well, I'll be off then...

(I don't know what's going on, but the prayer's
over now. So I need to go home and study.)
Hold on a moment.
Huh?
Good luck on your entrance exam.
*Grunt*...

(I turned around, and there stood the shrine
maiden, smiling.)
(I couldn't help but be rendered speechless.)
(She's so pretty.)

(And for some reason, she seems approachable.
Although I just met her, there's something
nostalgic about her energy.)

U-Um, thank you for what you did. I... feel so
much better. I feel like I'll be successful now.
I see. I'm glad.
I don't think I'll do it.
I see. That's unfortunate.

Yeah. Sorry for the trouble. I'm going to rely not
on God, but on my own skills.
Wait. Why don't you try the written oracle?
Huh? The written oracle?
Yes. It will give you your fortune for next year.

Um... that's kind of scary. If I pull a bad
fortune, then I feel like I'll fail this year,
too.

You won't pass anyway with a negative attitude
like that.
I-I see. You have a point there.

If you have bad luck, knowing beforehand will
allow you to work around it. It won't do you
any harm.
(*Grunt*... Her opinion seems legitimate this time.)
H-Hm... Then...
I guess I'll draw one written oracle.
All right. Then, grab that box.

Whoa... nice. So I just shake it, and a stick will
come out with a number on it, right?

Go ahead. Shake it, and read the text on the stick
that comes out.
Okay. YAH!
Okay... uh... "tawashi".
Congratulations. You won a tawashi.
WHAT?!
Here you go.

Hey...?! I thought this was a written oracle?!
Tawashi... it looks like a raffle prize at a
market!
Don't panic. Now look at the tawashi.
(Huh? Look at it...?)
Hm... oh, there's a piece of paper on it!

Open the paper and your fortune will be written
inside.
That's so roundabout! You didn't need the tawashi!

It's the tradition of this shrine. Don't let it
bother you.

(If I let everything about this place bother me,
it'd probably be the end of me. A-Anyways, I'll
read the paper. Let's see...)
Hm... Oh!
Wow, "Great Luck"!
Congratulations.

Nah, I know it's just a fortune, but that makes me
so happy.
That's nice.
(Oh... she smiled.)

(I thought she was pretty before, but when she
smiles, she's even prettier.)

(I'm glad I came to this shrine. I was able to
meet a pretty shrine maiden, too.)
Th-Thank you. I'm really glad I came here.

This shrine will always be waiting for you. Please
visit again next year.

O-Okay. I'll come again next year to pray for a
successful exam! Wait...?

The paper oracle overall seemed to be good luck,
but reading the fine print, the "school luck
says: "No chance. This is a time to endure!""
I look forward to seeing you again next year.
I-It can't beeeee!
(With that, I left the shrine.)
